Key Match Events: Gleyber Torres roped a double on the first pitch of the game
Gleyber Torres drove in Anthony Volpe on a two on, two out single in the top of the fifth
Giancarlo Stanton drove a ball 117 miles per hour into center field, which scored Aaron Judge, and gave the Yankees a 3-0 lead
Pre-Game Insights: Yankees manager Aaron Boone said after the game, 'But you get to this point, now weâ€™ll be down to the final four.'
Post-Match Reflections: Gerrit Cole said, 'It means a lot. It was a big game. It was a fun game. It was a great battle. Fun to be part of.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees clinched their second ALCS appearance in the last three years
The Yankees are four wins away from returning to the World Series for the first time since 2009
The ALCS will begin on Monday night with the Yankees taking on either the Detroit Tigers or Cleveland Guardians
Others: Michael Wacha allowed two runs on six hits as the losing pitcher for the Royals
Luke Weaver recorded his third save of the playoffs
Vinnie Pasquantino double that scored Bobby Witt Jr. was the only scoring of the Royals in the contest
